attributes.action: subsidise rail travel within the uk
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
As we have a government (supposedly) so committed to reducing carbon emissions why not subsidise rail travel and actually make a small effort to make it affordable to the masses. At the moment it will cost me £150 to travel to Edinburgh, almost twice the amount it will cost me to fly. We have a great network in this country and the labour government is allowing it to fall to pieces (just like a lot of other things). We could make rail travel a lot more affordable just like other European countries have done but instead we are wasting time and money trying to run it like a cheap (expensive) bus service. If only Gordon Brown would open his eyes for once (chance would be a fine thing). 
They are obviously so dependent on  road taxes that this sort of option is impossible to them.
After all they do have a war (unwanted) to win (lose).
